borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
description: Construction of a two storey rear and side extension
decision_conditions: <p style="">The proposal, by reason of siting, scale and design, would be an undesirable addition which would cause unacceptable loss of daylight, sunlight, outlook and privacy to neighbouring dwellings. This would result in a harmful impact to the amenity currently enjoyed by neighbouring occupiers. As such, the proposal fails to protect residential amenity and constitutes un-neighbourly development. The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development proposals protect residential amenity:</p><ul style=""><li style="">Paragraph 135(f) of the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2023)</li><li style="">Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</li><li style="">Paragraph 4.2, 5.3, and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</li><li style="">Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>

<p style="">The depth, scale, massing, and design of the proposed development&nbsp;would be overbearing and incongruous addition&nbsp;to the host&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dweliinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lrru28dwvwfxgyl5m" style="">dwellinghouse</span>, failing to be subordinate or harmonise with the scale and proportions of the host&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="dwellinghouse" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lrru28dvtcz6jurys" style="">dwellinghouse</span>&nbsp;and the terrace. The proposal would have a negative impact on the character of the wider area including&nbsp;<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="Becontree" data-wsc-lang="en_GB" data-wsc-id="lrru28i3uqowqb74n" style="">Becontree</span>&nbsp;Estate.&nbsp;The proposed development&nbsp;is contrary to:<br></p><ul style=""><li style="">Paragraphs 131, 135, 195, 200, and 209&nbsp;of the National Planning Policy Framework (December&nbsp;2023)<br></li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;D4 and HC1&nbsp;of the London Plan (March 2021)<br></li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;CP2 and CP3&nbsp;of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<br></li><li style="">Policies&nbsp;BP2&nbsp;and BP11&nbsp;of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<br></li><li style="">Strategic Policy SP 2 as well as Policies DMD 1, DMD 4,&nbsp;and DMD 6 of the London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan 2037&nbsp;(Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</li></ul>
